quest.name: We Need to Talk
journal: This Resistance fighter could use some help bringing people together.
objectives: Deliver forum invitations to residents of Ala Ghiri.

dialogue.name: LIBERATOR02836
dialogue.text: You don't look like you're from around here. This may sound strange, but I could use the help of a stranger right about now.

dialogue.name: LIBERATOR02836
dialogue.text: Seeing as our troops are going to be stationed here for the foreseeable future, I'd like to have a sit down of sorts with the people of Ala Mhigo. Hear their grievances, see what we can do to be as unintrusive as possible, that sort of thing.

dialogue.name: LIBERATOR02836
dialogue.text: The few people I've tried to speak with on the matter have been unreceptive, and I suspect as long as it's a soldier asking, the responses will all be the same.

dialogue.name: LIBERATOR02836
dialogue.text: They'd have no reason to turn you away, though. Would you hand out a few of these invitations, and perhaps ask them why people are so leery of us?

dialogue.name: LIBERATOR02836
dialogue.text: Hopefully they'll accept the invitation coming from you. I'd very much like to know what we can do to improve things around here.

dialogue.name: GERBOD
dialogue.text: Somethin' I can help you with, lasslad?

dialogue.name: GERBOD
dialogue.text: Talks with the Resistance? O' course I'll go. After all they've done for Ala Ghiri, the least we can do is hear what they have to say.

dialogue.name: GERBOD
dialogue.text: Just name the time an' I'll be there.

dialogue.name: JGHONAKO
dialogue.text: Why hello there, sweetlâ”€ Wait...you're not here for my services, are you?

dialogue.name: JGHONAKO
dialogue.text: An invitation to talks with the Resistance, eh? Mayhaps I can pick up new clientele while I'm there.

dialogue.name: JGHONAKO
dialogue.text: My coffers have been running a bit dry ever since the Garleans left. Not that I enjoyed their company, mind you. I did what I had to do to get by. The Resistance, however, is a different story. I'll gladly offer my services to the brave men and women who fought to save our home.

dialogue.name: JGHONAKO
dialogue.text: I look forward to getting to know the good men and women of the Resistance.

dialogue.name: ALDRUTH
dialogue.text: Oh, an adventurer. What can I do for you?

dialogue.name: ALDRUTH
dialogue.text: Speak with the Resistance? ...If it's all the same to you, I'd rather not.

dialogue.name: ALDRUTH
dialogue.text: I'm grateful for what they've done, truly I am. But I've lost too many to this fighting with the Garleans. They're like to run off and get killed just as we're getting to be friends, and my heart simply can't take it anymore.

dialogue.name: ALDRUTH
dialogue.text: I'm sorry, but I can't see myself attending any meetings with the Resistance.

dialogue.name: CIVILIAN02836
dialogue.text: Can I help you?

dialogue.name: CIVILIAN02836
dialogue.text: Hmmm... Thanks, but no. I appreciate the Resistance chasin' off the Garleans, but what happens when they come back? If worse comes to worst, I don't want anyone callin' me no Resistance lover.

dialogue.name: CIVILIAN02836
dialogue.text: Until I've seen how this all plays out, you can count me out of any talks with the Resistance.

dialogue.name: LIBERATOR02836
dialogue.text: You're back...and still with a few invitations, I see.

dialogue.name: LIBERATOR02836
dialogue.text: I see... <sigh> Well, at least now I know how they really feel about us. Suppose I can't blame them.

dialogue.name: LIBERATOR02836
dialogue.text: A few of them do seem willing to open up to us, though, so that's a start.

dialogue.name: LIBERATOR02836
dialogue.text: It's going to take time, but I'm sure the Resistance will earn their trust. Until then, we'll keep fighting to keep them safe, and maybe someday this will all seem like a distant memory.

dialogue.name: LIBERATOR02836
dialogue.text: Thanks again for your help. Now, if you'll excuse me, I have to prepare for our first forum with the townsfolk.

obj.n: For the Living and the Dead
